meanings.definition: To make or become longer in distance or time.
meanings.sent1: She is lengthening her hair by not cutting it for a year.
meanings.sent2: The days are lengthening as we move into summer.
meanings.sent3: The race was so long that even the lengthening shadows couldn't keep up.
meanings.sent4: His patience was like a rubber band, constantly lengthening until it finally snapped.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a ruler to show the lengthening line on the chalkboard.

meanings.definition: The act of making something longer.
meanings.sent1: The lengthening of the dress was done by adding extra fabric.
meanings.sent2: The lengthening of the meeting frustrated everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The lengthening of the movie made it feel like it would never end.
meanings.sent4: The lengthening of the shadows signaled the approach of evening.
meanings.sent5: The lengthening of the bridge was a marvel of engineering.
